properties.areaDesc: Upper Columbia Basin; Spokane Area; Coeur d'Alene Area
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 8:15PM PST until January 16 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TAKES AIM ON NORTH CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST
WASHINGTON AND THE NORTH IDAHO PANHANDLE...

.Our next winter storm will produce the heavy snow accumulations
over the north Cascades, Okanogan Valley, and the mountainous
portions of northeast Washington tonight into Thursday morning.
Accumulations of 5 to 8 inches will be common for counties along
the Canadian border.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3
inches.

* WHERE...Coeur d'Alene, Post Falls, Hayden, Worley, Grand
Coulee, Wilbur, Coulee City, Downtown Spokane, Spokane Valley,
Airway Heights, Cheney, Davenport, Rockford, and Fairfield.

* WHEN...Through 6 AM PST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall is expected this
evening becoming light overnight. For Lincoln county, the most
significant accumulations are expected along and north of the
Highway 2 corridor including Davenport and Wilbur.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST THURSDAY
